body:
Are the guilds of some inactive GM being hidden from /all? "They're still discoverable. Just siege them, dumbass." Ah yes, I either have 6 months to spare or 6 friends who all want to help me siege those 6 guilds I've always wanted to post in. "Just ask the admins to do it!" Ah yes, because I want the admins to spend all that time categorizing all those guilds with fewer than 3 posts each.

I don't even agree with your entire post (specifically, I don't agree with this part: "This needs to be reversed IMMEDIATELY"). I just want a separate, "uncensored" All that will show posts from uncategorized guilds too. Unfortunately, it's true that some guilds can't easily be categorized, and I think that the fallback category right now (in practice) is "casual discussion".

post.body:
Literally on the about page:

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/705884192692633740/791332001948893236/unknown.png)

For those of you who aren't aware the [second newest update](https://ruqqus.com/+changelog/post/5ywz/ruqqus-227-improved-content-filtering-guildmaster) in +changelog has effectively shadow-banned every single uncategorized guild from the All and Trending results.

@JosephGoebbels [pointed it out to me](https://ruqqus.com/+changelog/post/5ywz/ruqqus-227-improved-content-filtering-guildmaster/ktnp) that the admins are coercing basically every guild master to pick a category, if they want their guild to even grow basically. And if the guildmasters choose not to, the guild is effectively shadow-banned from All and Trending.

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/705884192692633740/791333388090212352/LeftismDiesWithoutCensorship.png)

Blatant censorship is occurring right before our eyes by the admins, and almost no one is actually calling them out on this.

Coercing guildmasters to pick a category if they even want their guild to be shown in All or Trending (which was always done before despite no categories) is completely ridiculous and takes away guildmaster and guild autonomy by forcing them to pigeonhole guilds in categories they may not even fit in (at least since there isn't a miscellaneous category yet or opt-out of categories).

A lot of guilds don't even have guildmasters, so there is literally no hope of them ever making it to All or Trending, unless someone sieges and changes the settings. But the chances of a siege are probably relatively low, not to mention guilds could be on indefinite wait to be categorized just to have content appear in All and Trending. This also goes for inactive guildmasters. Some guildmasters might just refuse to categorize all together only contributing to the censorship on the platform.

Also, we already have a switch for opting out of All and Trending.

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/705884192692633740/791336190245732372/unknown.png)

So in all reality, the whole [update](https://ruqqus.com/+changelog/post/5ywz/ruqqus-227-improved-content-filtering-guildmaster) is literally coercing guilds to pick a category or remain shadow-banned on Ruqqus.

**This needs to be reversed IMMEDIATELY.**
post.body_html:
Literally on the about page:

For those of you who aren't aware the second newest update in +changelog has effectively shadow-banned every single uncategorized guild from the All and Trending results.

@JosephGoebbels pointed it out to me that the admins are coercing basically every guild master to pick a category, if they want their guild to even grow basically. And if the guildmasters choose not to, the guild is effectively shadow-banned from All and Trending.

Blatant censorship is occurring right before our eyes by the admins, and almost no one is actually calling them out on this.

Coercing guildmasters to pick a category if they even want their guild to be shown in All or Trending (which was always done before despite no categories) is completely ridiculous and takes away guildmaster and guild autonomy by forcing them to pigeonhole guilds in categories they may not even fit in (at least since there isn't a miscellaneous category yet or opt-out of categories).

A lot of guilds don't even have guildmasters, so there is literally no hope of them ever making it to All or Trending, unless someone sieges and changes the settings. But the chances of a siege are probably relatively low, not to mention guilds could be on indefinite wait to be categorized just to have content appear in All and Trending. This also goes for inactive guildmasters. Some guildmasters might just refuse to categorize all together only contributing to the censorship on the platform.

Also, we already have a switch for opting out of All and Trending.

So in all reality, the whole update is literally coercing guilds to pick a category or remain shadow-banned on Ruqqus.

This needs to be reversed IMMEDIATELY.
post.title: Shadow Banning of Uncategorized Guilds on a Censorship Free Platform

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)
post.body_html:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

  • Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

  • Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

  • Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread here
post.title: Ruqqus 2.27 - Improved Content Filtering, Guildmaster Tools, and Mod Queue

post.body:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

* **access** - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
* **appearance** - Manage guild artwork and color
* **config** - Manage guild settings and description
* **content** - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also **full** permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.

body:
I saw the Ruqqie reaction gifs on Trending a while back.

>How was this made

Because I have no real animation program, I drew this frame by frame, and then I found an online gif converter. I found the official picture of Ruqqie, and I tried my best to replicate it. Then I tried to draw the first frame, the frame where Ruqqie is lowest, and the frame where Ruqqie is highest. Then I copied and pasted these frames over and over again, and I tried to animate the legs first. Then I made Ruqqie move up and down to see how it looked (and figure out how many frames it should have), and then I tried to redraw the legs in some frames if they looked weird and animate the arms. Then I made Ruqqie still again (no up and down motion because it's easier to make the eyes and mouth stay in place), and I tried to animate the eyes and mouth. Then I drew the hat, and I copied and pasted it into all the frames. Then I re-added the up and down motion, and I tried to get the hat to move.

Since I have no real animation program, I'm not sure how you're actually supposed to animate things. I just looked at the previous frames (and sometimes copied and pasted parts of them into the next frame) to determine how to draw the next frame, and I played it over and over again to see if it looked ok .

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

Then I drew the hat, and I copied and pasted it into all the frames. Then I re-added the up and down motion, and I tried to get the hat to move.

Since I have no real animation program, I'm not sure how you're actually supposed to animate things. post.body:
How your guild may be affected if you haven't had the chance to categorize it yet (before and after comparisons):

[The update](https://ruqqus.com/+changelog/post/5ywz/ruqqus-227-improved-content-filtering-guildmaster) was introduced on December 22, 2020 at 03:16:01 UTC.

[+Science](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224102756/https://ruqqus.com/+Science?sort=new): Before the update, posts used to get at least some votes. After the update? Basically nothing.

[+Conservative](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224105721/https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative?sort=new): Similar situation. [Posts made before the update got some votes](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224105612/https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative?sort=new&page=4&t=all), but after it, barely any posts got voted on.

[+Programming](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224102900/https://ruqqus.com/+Programming?sort=new): Several posts made before the update had scores of 10-30, but afterwards, they mostly had scores of less than 10.

[+Linux](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224102723/https://ruqqus.com/+Linux?sort=new): Same thing.

[+WakeUpWhitePeople](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224101347/https://ruqqus.com/+WakeUpWhitePeople?sort=new): Every post made after the update has a score of less than 100, and many even have single digit scores. [Before the update](https://web.archive.org/web/20201224101400/https://ruqqus.com/+WakeUpWhitePeople?sort=new&page=2&t=all), the majority of posts had double digit scores, and several had triple digit scores.

(Note: I didn't look at any of the posts themselves, so I don't know if the ones made after the announcement are truly less interesting. And with the less active guilds, the amount of posts made after the update may be small, and streaks of posts with less engagement can happen even if the guild isn't hidden from /all. However, I didn't know how to find active, uncategorized guilds, so I just found some from /browse.)

***

I have my own anecdote too. I made [a post](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqie/post/6296/ruqqie-jumping) in +Ruqqie, an uncategorized guild, and it has 0 engagement so far. I also made a ton of posts in +RuqqusBugs, a categorized guild, and some have scores of [5](https://ruqqus.com/+RuqqusBugs/post/6290/user-is-blocking-you-and-you) or [6](https://ruqqus.com/+RuqqusBugs/post/6282/exiled-users-can-accept-guildmaster-invites).

+Linux: Same thing.

+WakeUpWhitePeople: Every post made after the update has a score of less than 100, and many even have single digit scores. Before the update, the majority of posts had double digit scores, and several had triple digit scores.

(Note: I didn't look at any of the posts themselves, so I don't know if the ones made after the announcement are truly less interesting. And with the less active guilds, the amount of posts made after the update may be small, and streaks of posts with less engagement can happen even if the guild isn't hidden from /all. However, I didn't know how to find active, uncategorized guilds, so I just found some from /browse.)

I have my own anecdote too. I made a post in +Ruqqie, an uncategorized guild, and it has 0 engagement so far. I also made a ton of posts in +RuqqusBugs, a categorized guild, and some have scores of 5 or 6.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

@kek, I made a post in +Ruqqie, an uncategorized guild, which means basically no one will see it. How does the current categorization system not encourage users to post everything in +general and existing large guilds that they know for sure are categorized? I still want an "unfiltered all" that is unaffected by the categorization system so posts in guilds with inactive GMs can still be seen at least somewhere.

body:
I never thought I would see this day. Do you think that alts should be permabanned at all? (Maybe they can get the person to choose the guilds they like the best, get them to choose the account they like the best, make them the GM of those guilds on that account (the "main account"), remove all the other guilds from their alts, and only ban the alts for 7 days, like the main account. This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

This may be a bit hard to accomplish without PMs or anything like that though. I just don't really like that all these accounts are being banned. I liked looking at fifthfiend's post history to look for complaints about ruqqus censorship, and I can't do that anymore.)

If that's not going to happen, I agree that posting activity should be the indicator of what is the "main account", and I also think that alts should only be permabanned if they were actually used for evading the 10 guild limit.
